FuncDef:
The dhcp user chasten disable command disables DHCP user access restriction.
The undo dhcp user chasten disable command enables DHCP user access restriction.
By default, DHCP user access restriction is enabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
DHCP user access restriction is used to restrict the connection requests of DHCP users. By default, DHCP user access restriction is enabled. If this function is abnormal, you can run the dhcp user chasten disable command to disable it so that DHCP users can go online successfully. In normal cases, you are advised to enable DHCP user access restriction.
